OMEGA-3-ACID ETHYL ESTERS

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Side effects
  • National funding/access decisions
  • Cautions
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Adjunct to diet and statin in type IIb or III hypertriglyceridaemia, Adjunct to diet in type IV hypertriglyceridaemia,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 2 capsules daily, dose to be taken with food, increased if necessary to 4 capsules daily.

Adjunct in secondary prevention in those who have had a myocardial infarction in the preceding 3 months,

By mouth

  • For adults
    1 capsule daily, dose to be taken with food.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturers advise use only if potential benefit outweighs risk—no information available.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Dyspepsia, nausea,

uncommon: Abdominal pain, dizziness, gastritis, taste disturbances,

rare: Acne, headache, hepatic disorders, hyperglycaemia, rash,

veryRare: Gastro-intestinal haemorrhage, hypotension, increased white cell count, nasal dryness, urticaria,

National funding/access decisions

Cautions regarding administration

  • Anticoagulant treatment (bleeding time increased)
  • haemorrhagic disorders

Prepared medicinal forms of OMEGA-3-ACID ETHYL ESTERS

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Capsule
